description.narrative:
The Kiribati Communications Initiative provides the blueprint for AusAID to achieve a better understanding of Australia’s development assistance program in Kiribati, and in particular the priorities agreed to under the Australia-Kiribati Partnership for Development. The strategy will also assist in developing greater awareness and support within the Australian community of the aid program in Kiribati.
The Kiribati Communications Strategy (2010-2012) links to the communications messages and priorities for 2009 as outlined in the International Public Diplomacy Strategy 2009. Key messages of this strategy include: 1. The Australian Government’s priority is to work in partnership with developing countries to fight poverty effectively 2.Australia is a good international citizen, promoting a fair go for all 3.Together we can accelerate progress towards the Millennium Development goals
